title: Player behaviour going overboard?
body:
Today there are 8 posts on the front page of people having gotten 14day suspensions or permas without escalation.

What is going on? Has a new player behaviour team hit town? Has there been a rollout of harsher penalties for lesser offences?

Genuinely curious because a lot of people seem puzzled at having received punishments which abandoned the punishment tiers for behaviour that has up until now gone on unpunished.

replies.body:
I've noticed it too, I think it could be related to the [recent change in management](https://www.riotgames.com/explore/founders-lane-swap) over at Riot but who knows.

As to whether this move is good or bad remains to be seen IMO. It's good that the system is going to punish and escalate those who deserve it more quickly, but inevitably we're probably going to see some punishments that aren't very fair or just a bit harsh.

I hope this turns out well though, and we see a big reduction in toxicity :D

The war on toxicity is like the war on terror. There is no enemy. There is no victor. It is just a sales pitch.

My ban was in large part for the use of a racist term which the player behaviour specialist even acknowledged was not being used as an insult but to clarify what the other person said (they said "goo k work" and I replied "did you mean goo k or good" because I wanted to see whether I was going to report for racism). Got a 14 day suspension on the basis of this even when player behaviour agreed that the system picked me up unfairly and with no context to the conversation.

Frankly I've found the escalation of punishments and the refusal of player behaviour to engage in any serious dialogue about it to be a turn off. Was even encouraged to quit by player behaviour team AFTER the big trigger for the suspension was agreed by player behaviour to have been falsely flagged. And yeah I swear like a pirate but I'm Australian for f*cks sake - this is the land of calling our enemies "mate" and our mates "c*nt".

Pretty pissed off with this direction to be honest. I've played and enjoyed the game for many many years now but this experience has really turned me right off. And it sounds like it is turning others off too.

I'm sure riot will still make a shit tonne of money (particularly so with the changes to BE which appear to be jumping on the "lets get kids to gamble irresponsibly" bandwagon). But after respecting the highly profitable business model of riot and promoting it as the "right" way to do FTP, the loot-box style direction is fast changing my opinion. Profits at any cost mentalities do have a cost when you exploit players. Look at battlefront 2.

In less than a month my opinion of the game and the management has been one of "this is the best game in the world, run by people who care about player experiences" to "this is turning into an EA-style shitfest with power tripping player behaviour "specialists" who have made a conscious choice to disrespect the players and head towards an exploitative business model because it is run by accountants seeking profit at any cost".

I understand what your saying there. But lets say your in Bronze 5. Like I was before I got into silver. When your in Bronze 5 your MMR is low as it can go.
From what I have seen going from Bronze to silver is the toxic level drops as you climb. Dont get me wrong thou, people rage. But it is less as time goes on.
In bronze 5 to Bronze 3 the toxic level is really insane.. People troll a lot of the time. In fact just like the game I am in right now.. Someone wanted Raka top. The support locked in Raka. So top stole middles pick and now middle and top are going full tilt at one another.
If we look at there [history](http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=joshuy) { no I am not naming and shaming. They didnt rage or troll they got over it in game} you can see.. A few loses in a row. { This is the [account](http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=Istypuff) I am playing on right now }

This puts the player in a auto defense mode. Meaning they are waiting to be yelled at for not being able to look at the mini map or something like that. Which happens a lot in B5 area. Less as you move up but a lot.

So when you take into account that they are the lowest MMR.. Where do they fall to to get the heavy sided match?
When someone is losing endlessly.. They be come toxic. When a player wins endlessly they become bored and leave the game. This is why Riot try's for the 50/50.

But if it was 50/50 like they said. Why is this [player](http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=deportednepali) on 37% or better yet this [player](http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=Imaqtpie) is on 68%.

This isn't 50/50. So with that in mind.. When a player falls to say 35% win rate. Riot should have something in place to allow to them to get back to 50%. 
It would reduce the amount of toxic people in the game as they will be saying to them self's. I lost this but that is okay. I know I will win soon.
Riot can kept it under raps so no one knows this is happening but instead of just going " BAN HAMMER FOR ANYONE I THINK IS TOXIC ".

Fear of disappointment and fear of being thrown out might work on some but it won't work on all. If Riot had a fair system in place. People would respect it. But going from what you see.. There is a issue.

Like Essembie says, it's not to stop toxicity, or it would be banning legitmately toxic players, which it seems to let through the cracks.

It's to look like they are, because sure as fuck a lot of those bans are false flags, because i can't believe that this system can ban shit, because it can't detect context (which is a lot of what determines what is ban worthy.)
